intro: Geraniospermum sibthorpiifolium, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
